column1: INTERPRETIVE COMMUNICATION  - (Listening & Reading â€“ One-way comprehension)

column2: Recognizes isolated words and memorized phrases with strong contextual support.
column3: Understands main ideas and isolated details in short, familiar audio texts.
column5: Follows simple spoken messages beyond rehearsed material with partial comprehension.
column6: Understands sentence-length spoken language on everyday topics.
column7: Understands connected spoken discourse with predictable structure.
column10: Understands most conversations on familiar topics, including narration and description.
column11: Understands paragraph-length spoken discourse across time frames.
column12: Understands detailed spoken texts on personal and public topics.
column13: Understands extended discourse with nuance and detail across contexts.

column2: Identifies familiar words, symbols, and cognates in isolation.
column3: Understands short, simple texts on familiar topics using context and visuals.
column5: Grasps the gist of short paragraph-length texts when scaffolded.
column6: Understands sentence-level texts across everyday contexts.
column7: Understands connected texts with organization and supporting detail.
column10: Understands narrations and descriptions in familiar genres.
column11: Understands paragraph-length texts across time frames.
column12: Understands detailed, organized texts on personal and public topics.
column13: Understands extended texts with nuance and perspective.

column1: INTERPERSONAL COMMUNICATION - (Listening & Speaking â€“ Two-way negotiation of meaning)
Interpersonal Oral Interaction â€“ Full Spectrum
column2: Exchanges meaning using isolated words and memorized phrases, relying heavily on repetition, gestures, and support. Understanding and responses are limited and often fragmented.
column3: Participates in simple, predictable exchanges using short sentences. Understands and responds to direct questions related to self and immediate environment, though interaction is often reactive.
column5: Manages uncomplicated conversations by asking and answering simple questions. Begins to recombine language and repair breakdowns, but cannot yet sustain interaction consistently.
column6: Creates with language to handle everyday interactions and transactions. Can initiate, maintain, and close simple conversations across familiar contexts.
column7: Sustains interaction using strings of sentences. Can exchange information, clarify meaning, and maintain conversations on familiar topics with increased independence.
column10: Participates in conversations with emerging narration and description, but performance is not yet consistently paragraph-length.
column11: Sustains paragraph-length interaction, narrating and describing in past, present, and future time frames. Can handle situations with a complication.
column12: Engages confidently in extended conversations with detail, organization, and clarity, interweaving narration and description.
column13: Communicates with ease, precision, and fluency across contexts, adapting language to the interaction and interlocutor.

column2: Interpertive Note: As proficiency increases, listening and speaking become more tightly integrated. Growth is visible not just in what students say, but in how they interpret, respond, clarify, and sustain interaction.

column1: Interpersonal Written Interaction â€“ Full Spectrum
column2: Exchanges meaning by copying or reproducing familiar words and phrases. Relies heavily on models and may switch to another language to maintain interaction.
column3: Participates in simple written exchanges using short, practiced sentences. Can read and respond to highly predictable messages on familiar topics.
column5: Manages basic written interactions by asking and answering simple questions and recombining familiar language, though exchanges remain short and uneven.
column6: Creates with language in written exchanges to meet everyday needs. Can maintain back-and-forth communication using connected sentences.
column7: Sustains written interaction using strings of sentences, clarifying meaning and exchanging information across familiar contexts.
column10: Participates in written exchanges with emerging paragraph-level organization, though breakdowns may occur when complexity increases.
column11: Sustains paragraph-length written interaction, narrating and describing across time frames in exchanges.
column12: Engages in extended written interaction with detail, cohesion, and clarity, adjusting language to context and audience.
column13: Writes interactively with precision, nuance, and stylistic control, maintaining coherent and purposeful exchanges across contexts.

column2: Interpertive Note: Written interpersonal growth is visible in studentsâ€™ ability to respond appropriately, build on othersâ€™ ideas, and maintain interaction, not just in sentence accuracy.

column1: PRESENTATIONAL COMMUNICATION - (Speaking & Writing â€“ One-way production)

column3: Presents basic information using short sentences on familiar topics.
column5: Produces connected sentences to express personal meaning.
column6: Creates with language to present on everyday topics.
column7: Sustains organized presentations using sentence strings.
column11: Produces paragraph-length presentations across time frames.
column12: Produces detailed, organized presentations on personal and public topics.
column13: Presents with clarity, precision, and rhetorical control.

column2: Copies or reproduces words and phrases.
column3: Writes simple sentences and short messages on familiar topics.
column5: Begins short paragraph-like writing through recombination.
column6: Writes connected sentences to communicate meaning.
column7: Writes organized texts using sentence strings.
column10: Writes with emerging paragraph structure and narration.
column11: Writes paragraph-length texts across time frames.
column12: Writes detailed, organized texts with cohesion and clarity.
column13: Writes with precision, nuance, and stylistic control.
